definition: inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: GMO foods do not have to be labeled in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，轉基因食品毋須用籤條標明。

sentences.english: Now please fill out this green label.
sentences.chinese: 現在請填寫這個綠色籤條。

sentences.english: A large address label was gummed to the package.
sentences.chinese: 包裝袋上貼着一大張地址籤條。

sentences.english: All archives have labels classified by category, so that it is easier to gather data.
sentences.chinese: 檔案上都有按類別劃分的籤條，查找資料比較容易。

sentences.english: To tag up any surface with paint or ink.
sentences.chinese: 附以籤條增加有油漆或墨水的任何表面。

sentences.english: Attach this label to your luggage.
sentences.chinese: 把這個籤條系在你的行李上。

sentences.english: Just tag along until you catch up.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅附以籤條沿着直到你追趕。

sentences.english: Go ahead and stick a few post-its to the back for marking significant passages, too.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以在重要的內容背面貼便籤條來做記號。

sentences.english: Look here. First, drive this stick through the beef.
sentences.chinese: 瞧這兒，首選，用這根籤條把牛肉穿起來。
